Hi,

In a project I am working on, the current test suite is modeled on the code from 
this JavaWorld article:

http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit-p4.html

This approach has each test implement a static final field TEST_ALL_TEST_TYPE 
which determines what logical "Group" the test falls into.  For example, Cactus 
tests (requires container) vs. non-Cactus tests (no container required).

I would like to find some other approach which lets me be more flexible about 
grouping the tests.  I would especially like something that allows groups to 
overlap.  For example, I may want to run a subset of both Cactus and non-Cactus 
tests related to a specific area of the application (because the entire suite of 
tests takes too long to run iteratively in a Test-Driven-Development mode).

Is there any type of test runner or documented suite pattern which will let me 
do this?

I would still prefer for the decision of what "group" a test falls into to be 
made by a property of the test class itself, rather than having to maintain a 
hardcoded list of test class names in some other place (since this is less 
likely to get updated, or may get updated incorrectly).

Thanks,
Chad

P.S.  I know I could probably modify the existing code to do this, but I'm 
looking for something simpler, which would also preferably handle the directory 
recursing and test-finding rather than having to hardcode all that logic.
